category: Member city/provincial sports association regulations/Article 29 (Term of office of executives)
contents: Article 29 (Term of office of executives) ① The term of office of executives shall be as follows. Revised on March 23, 2017, March 30, 2020, October 6, 2021, and July 5, 2023. Directors, including the Chairman and Vice Chairman, shall be appointed for four years, but may be reappointed only once. . 2. The Secretary General shall serve a term of four years, but may be reappointed only once. However, the Chairman may extend his term as Secretary General to two years by resolution of the Board of Directors. 3. The auditor shall serve for two years, but may be reappointed only once. 4. If an ex officio public official is an executive, the term of office and reappointment restrictions do not apply. ② Notwithstanding paragraph 1, executives of city/provincial sports associations may be recognized as exceptions to the limit on the number of consecutive terms of office by resolution of the sports fair committee of the sports association. Revised on March 23, 2017, on July 5, 2023. ③ When calculating the limit on the number of terms of office for the Chairman pursuant to Paragraph 1, the period during which he/she served as an officer other than the Chairman is not included. Revised March 23, 2017, May 10, 2022. ④ When calculating the limit on the number of terms of office for the Vice President pursuant to Paragraph 1, the period serving as Chairman shall be included, but the period serving as Director, Auditor, or Secretary General shall not be included. . ⑤ When calculating the limit on the number of terms of office for directors and auditors pursuant to paragraph 1, the period served as chairman and vice-chairman shall be included, but the period served as secretary general shall not be included. ⑥ Deleted September 2, 2019 ⑦ The term of office of the Chairman shall begin from the date of the next regular general meeting after being elected as Chairman and shall continue until the day before the fourth regular general meeting thereafter. However, if elected in a by-election, the term begins from the date the election is confirmed. Newly established on September 2, 2019, October 6, 2021. ⑧ The term of office of the Vice President and Directors (excluding the Secretary General) shall begin from the date of the regular general meeting at which the Vice President and Director are appointed and shall continue until the day before the fourth regular general meeting thereafter. However, if the general meeting delegates the election of directors to the chairman, the term of office begins on the date the chairman elects the directors. However, the secretary general shall serve the relevant term of office. Newly established on September 2, 2019, October 6, 2021. ⑨ The term of office of the auditor shall begin from the day after the date of the regular general meeting at which the auditor was appointed and shall continue until the date of the second regular general meeting thereafter. Newly established on September 2, 2019 ⑩ The term of office of the by-elected officers shall be the remaining term of office of the predecessor, and the term of office of officers appointed as the number of officers has increased shall be the remaining term of office of the other officers. Revised May 10, 2022 ⑪ When calculating the number of times an executive has been reappointed, whether he or she has been reappointed is calculated as one reappointment, regardless of whether the expiration date of the previous term and the date of inauguration as the successor are consecutive. (Including cases of resignation during the term of office) Newly established May 10, 2022 ⑫ Officers elected by-election and officers appointed through augmentation shall be counted as having served once, regardless of the period of office. However, if a resigned executive is elected or increased to an executive position within the same term, the number of terms of office will not be additionally calculated. Newly established 2022. 5. 10.
